Class CannonGun

  • java.lang.Object
    • CannonGun

  • public class CannonGun
extends java.lang.Object
    The CannonGun is used for shooting at Targets at the end of each level. To shoot, the user clicks their Left-Mouse button. The CannonGun carries out the shootBall() method to shoot out a CannonBall object.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private com.jme3.asset.AssetManager assetManager
      World's AssetManager
      private com.jme3.bullet.BulletAppState bulletApp
      The BulletAppState (for integrating physics)
      private com.jme3.scene.Node cannonBalls
      A Node of all cannonBalls fired from the gun.
      static int shootSpeed
      Shooting speed

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CannonGun(com.jme3.asset.AssetManager a, com.jme3.bullet.BulletAppState b)
      Constructs a CannonGun object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void shootBall(com.jme3.math.Vector3f location, com.jme3.math.Vector3f direction, com.jme3.scene.Node w)
      The shootBall() method creates a new CannonBall object and sets all necessary properties for its Spatial and RigidBodyControl.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CannonGun

        public CannonGun(com.jme3.asset.AssetManager a,
                 com.jme3.bullet.BulletAppState b)
        Constructs a CannonGun object. Initializes the assetManager that it will use when creating new CannonBalls, the BulletAppState (which allows for Physics to be implemented in the game), and the CannonBalls node where all future cannon ball projectiles are added.
        Parameters:
        a - reference to the World's assetManager
        b - reference to the World's BulletAppState

    • Method Detail

      • shootBall

        public void shootBall(com.jme3.math.Vector3f location,
                      com.jme3.math.Vector3f direction,
                      com.jme3.scene.Node w)
        The shootBall() method creates a new CannonBall object and sets all necessary properties for its Spatial and RigidBodyControl. Then, it attaches it to the World's rootNode so the user can see it in the game.
        Parameters:
        location - the current location of the character
        direction - the current direction of the character
        w - the World
        See Also:
        CannonBall

      • getCannonBallNode

        public com.jme3.scene.Node getCannonBallNode()
